intro: Gymnolomia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican gymnolomia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Gymnolomia costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
